intro: Crataegus petrodavisii, commonly known as the Davis hawthorn, is a species of flowering plant in the family Rosaceae. It is native to the southwestern United States, particularly found in California and Nevada. This shrub or small tree typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. The plant produces white or pink flowers in the spring, followed by edible berries that are an important food source for local wildlife. Its hardy nature and ornamental value make it a notable species in its native habitat.
